definitions.definition: the middle point of a circle or sphere, equidistant from every point on the circumference or surface.
a point or part that is equally distant from all sides, ends, or surfaces of something; the middle.
a pivot or axis of rotation.
examples: the galactic rotation of the solar system around the galactic center

definitions.definition: a political party or group holding moderate opinions.
the middle player in a line or group in many games.
examples: Terry played center on the basketball team

definitions.definition: a core, such as the filling in a piece of chocolate.
a conical adjustable support for a workpiece in a lathe or similar machine.
the point from which an activity or process is directed, or on which it is focused.
examples: the city was a center of discontent

definitions.definition: the most important place in the respect specified.
examples: Geneva was then the center of the international world

definitions.definition: a place or group of buildings where a specified activity is concentrated.
have or cause to have something as (a major concern or theme).
examples: the case centers around the couple's adopted children
synonyms: be based "the story centers on a doctor"

definitions.definition: (of an activity) occur mainly in or around (a specified place).
examples: the mercantile association was centered in northern Germany
to center the needle, turn the knob

definitions.definition: pass the ball back from the ground to another player to begin a down; snap.
